title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 April 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:10 <abusenius\_> has quit  
00:30 <jomo> has quit  
00:57 <jomo> has joined #xwiki  
02:06 <jomo> has quit  
02:29 <@sdumitriu> cjd: Since you're going to be the Release Manager for 4.1, I'd like to set up all the needed accounts early  
02:31 <@sdumitriu> So, do you have accounts on: ow2, freecode, purl.org?  
02:31 <@sdumitriu> Do you have admin rights on jira?  
02:41 <jamie\_\_wiki> has quit  
03:16 <cjd> has quit  
03:17 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
03:20 <@cjd> ow2 yes, freecode no, purl.org no  
03:54 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:04 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
07:02 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:05 <Denis> has quit  
07:59 <jomo> has joined #xwiki  
08:18 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <@cjd> Quite a nest of jvm bugs surrounding the System.exit() call. It seems that if you change anything using reflection which would make it not be called, that's ignored.  
09:18 <@cjd> oh haha, it was another test causing it to be hit  
09:28 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol cts \* r93bfbc7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/93bfbc7c2732f2eccde569adb876c34082db882c / (3 files): XRENDERING-187: Implement a Rendering Compatibility Test Suite ...  
09:34 <CIA-74> tmortagne master \* r9654331 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/96543319ae256a4076f437de9fee3fa4dacb84b0 / (11 files in 10 dirs): XRENDERING-192: Reduce xdom+xml/current markup size ...  
09:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <@sdumitriu> Hey team, seems that jodconverter is almost dead  
09:41 <@sdumitriu> The author is hoping that someone will fork it and maintain it  
09:41 <@sdumitriu> Do we want to be the forkers?  
09:42 <vmassol> no  
09:42 <vmassol> I think we haven't stuff on our plate already  
09:42 <vmassol> we have too much already  
09:43 <vmassol> s/haven't/have enough/  
09:44 <vmassol> is there a chance that the content of jodconverter is going to be included in OO itself?  
09:44 <@sdumitriu> Nope, it's a Java library  
09:44 <@sdumitriu> We still have to add it to our classpath  
09:44 <vmassol> and?  
09:44 <vmassol> why couldn't they include a java lib  
09:44 <vmassol> ?  
09:45 <vmassol> the OO project is large  
09:45 <vmassol> and surely mode of several modules  
09:45 <@sdumitriu> Perhaps I misunderstood what you mean by "include"  
09:45 <vmassol> s/mode/made/  
09:45 <@sdumitriu> Did you mean "adopt the project", or "include the functionality in the office program"?  
09:46 <vmassol> I meant OO project and not OO binary indeed  
09:46 <@sdumitriu> K, then it is possible  
09:46 <@sdumitriu> But I guess someone should propose that  
09:46 <vmassol> it's the most logical place IMO  
09:46 <vmassol> much more logical than within xwiki  
09:46 <@sdumitriu> Since at the moment it's GPL, it could be adopted bu LibreOffice  
09:46 <vmassol> ah yes s/OO/LO/  
09:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: we should release 4.0 today if you can  
09:50 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol cts \* r5137cb8 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/5137cb80f5f83979b4d245c25cfd903839dd0f95 / (6 files in 3 dirs): XRENDERING-187: Implement a Rendering Compatibility Test Suite ...  
09:50 <+tmortagne> vmassol: if there is nothing blocker yes I can take care of that today  
09:52 <vmassol> I don't see any blocker  
09:52 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ?  
09:52 <@sdumitriu> All good from my POV  
09:53 <@sdumitriu> All databases should work

10:33 <vmassol> it doesn't have all features yet but it's functional and we can start using it for real  
10:37 <vmassol> here it comes

11:10 <vmassol> the blog post on the deprecation day is still not visible  
11:10 <vmassol> need to check the timeout

15:04 <+mflorea> vmassol: I see that the legacy modules that wrap their original modules use the aspectj-maven-plugin, but what if I don't have any aspects? I have to choose between maven assembly plugin and maven-shade-plugin, right?  
15:04 <vmassol> mflorea: not shade plugin  
15:04 <vmassol> assembly sounds right  
15:04 <+mflorea> ok, thanks  
15:08 <polx> has quit  
15:33 <CIA-74> tmortagne stable-4.0.x \* r64ea9ca https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/64ea9cac9d4e88028968778833388741fb863037 / xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml : Put back clirr excludes removed by mistake - http://git.io/xJTcIg  
15:56 <Roni> has quit  
15:56 <+tmortagne> mflorea: any idea how xwiki-rendering build finally worked on jenkins ? we have the same issue with xwiki-rendering-4.0  
15:59 <+mflorea> I don't know how xwiki-rendering was fixed, but for xwiki-rendering-4.0, make sure it is configured to use maven 3.0.3 and build locally (-N) commons and commons-pom, or remove them from the local repo no the agent.  
16:00 <+lucaa> hello Denis1  
16:00 <+tmortagne> mflorea: yes i modified the maven version used in xwiki-renedring-4.0 job  
16:00 <+tmortagne> but not better  
16:00 <+tmortagne> hmm did not removed the pom files  
16:00 <+tmortagne> trying that then  
16:00 <+mflorea> you still have to build locally commons and commons-pom or clear the maven repo  
16:01 <+lucaa> I found this issue here http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XEM-216 which seems to have been caused / introduced by https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b268ed21bd2c39975a5b6887e870c0d1b7654510#xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/XWiki.java (that's the place where I noticed that updateSchema dissappeared from updateDatabase, where it was preventing that issue to happen)  
16:03 <+tmortagne> removed the files, lets see  
16:04 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol master \* r5aa9d3a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/5aa9d3a6b762b09b944be29ba4cba6fdd5cd6534 / (16 files in 10 dirs): XRENDERING-195: Separate Plain Syntax from Rendering API by moving it to a Syntax module - http://git.io/naldXA

16:09 <+tmortagne> mflorea: same thing :(  
16:09 <+mflorea> did you try building manually on that agent?  
16:10 <+tmortagne> not yet  
16:10 <+tmortagne> just removed them  
16:10 <+tmortagne> removed commons pom files  
16:10 <+mflorea> ok  
16:12 <+tmortagne> build rendering-standalone does noy work either by hand on the agent  
16:13 <+tmortagne> hmm  
16:13 <+tmortagne> looks like building commons pom files worked  
16:14 <+tmortagne> so removing them was not enough  
16:14 <+tmortagne> restarting the job  
16:18 <+mflorea> this maven-shade-plugin bug is a pain  
16:19 <+tmortagne> and very weird, I don't see what could possibly be different between pom comming from maven.xwiki.org and one built locally

16:47 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol master \* rb3ab19b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/b3ab19b0ad254713a58eb4886ce31baf96995d01 / (7 files in 7 dirs): XRENDERING-187: Implement a Rendering Compatibility Test Suite ...  
17:00 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'm stuck at mixing clirr with assembly. The problem is that clirr doesn't take into account the generated jar, even if it is bound to the verify lifecycle phase. And assembly generates the jar without copying/unpacking the classes in target so that clirr can see them.. Any hints?  
17:01 <vmassol> mflorea: interesting problem  
17:01 <vmassol> assembly will generate a secondary artifact  
17:01 <+mflorea> i.e. clirr complains that some classes from the original/clean jar are missing, although they are in the final jar generated by assembly  
17:01 <+mflorea> well  
17:01 <+mflorea> I configured assembly to overwrite the main one  
17:02 <vmassol> that's not very good  
17:02 <+mflorea> but still clirr doesn't take into account the jar  
17:02 <vmassol> let me find something  
17:02 <+mflorea> yes, I noticed the warnings  
17:02 <+mflorea> but I though this way clirr will take the jar into account  
17:02 <+mflorea> but clirr uses the unpacked /target/classes  
17:03 <vmassol> hmm no, I thought the build helper plugin could help but no: http://mojo.codehaus.org/build-helper-maven-plugin/index.html  
17:03 <vmassol> (was thinking about http://mojo.codehaus.org/build-helper-maven-plugin/attach-artifact-mojo.html)  
17:03 <vmassol> but forget that, it's not going to be useful here  
17:03 <vmassol> well  
17:04 <vmassol> one easy solution is to use the AspctJ plugin  
17:04 <vmassol> it's probably the best IMO  
17:04 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:04 <vmassol> because  
17:04 <vmassol> 1) it's not going to take longer  
17:04 <vmassol> 2) as soon as you have an aspect you'll need to use it anwyay  
17:04 <+mflorea> indeed  
17:04 <vmassol> 3 using it will make it consistent across all legacy modules  
17:04 <vmassol> s/3/3)/  
17:05 <+mflorea> ok
